output_questions.question:
What does this code display?

```html
<note>
  <to>Tove</to>
  <from>Jani</from>
  <heading>Reminder</heading>
  <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>
```
output_questions.output: Nothing visible in a browser by default.
output_questions.explanation: This is XML, not HTML. Browsers do not render XML tags visually unless styled or processed. The code demonstrates XML's custom tag structure.

output_questions.question:
What is rendered?

```html
<html>
  <data>
    <name>John</name>
  </data>
</html>
```
output_questions.output: Nothing special is displayed; browsers ignore unknown tags.
output_questions.explanation: Browsers don't render custom tags like <data> or <name> unless styled; only text content appears.

output_questions.question:
What happens when you open this file as HTML?

```html
<message>
  <sender>Jane</sender>
  <text>Hello!</text>
</message>
```
output_questions.explanation: Browsers do not display custom tags (like XML) without CSS or JS. Only HTML tags have default rendering.

output_questions.question:
What is the output? ```html

<user>data</user>

```
output_questions.explanation: Using HTML entities like < and > shows literal angle brackets and the tag as text.

output_questions.question:
What does this HTML show? ```html

<person name="Alice">Hello</person>

```
output_questions.explanation: HTML entities display literal XML tags as text, not as elements.

output_questions.question:
What is the visible result?

```html
<note><to>Tove</to><from>Jani</from></note>
```
output_questions.explanation: These are custom XML tags. Browsers will not render them as visible content.

output_questions.question:
What is rendered by this code? ```html

<note>This is XML</note>

```
output_questions.explanation: Entities are used to show XML tags as text.

output_questions.question:
What happens with this snippet?

```html
<book>
  <title>HTML & XML</title>
  <author>Author Name</author>
</book>
```
output_questions.explanation: Browsers do not render XML tags unless explicitly handled.

output_questions.question:
What does the browser show? ```html

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

```
output_questions.explanation: The XML declaration is shown as text using entities.

output_questions.question:
What is displayed? ```html

HTML is for web pages. XML is for data.

```
output_questions.output: HTML is for web pages. XML is for data.
output_questions.explanation: This is plain text; it is displayed as a paragraph.

output_questions.question:
What is output by this code? ```html

<note><to>A</to></note>

```
output_questions.explanation: Entities ensure the XML markup appears as text, not as elements.

output_questions.question:
What happens if you use an unclosed XML tag in HTML?

```html
<data><item>Test</item></data
```
output_questions.output: Rendering may break; the browser could ignore or misinterpret markup after the unclosed tag.
output_questions.explanation: Browsers are forgiving, but broken markup can cause unexpected layout issues.

output_questions.question:
What is rendered? ```html

<item>1</item><item>2</item>

```
output_questions.explanation: Entities render the XML tags as text.

output_questions.question:
What does this code show?

```html
<data>
  <name>Value</name>
</data>
```
output_questions.explanation: Custom XML tags are not rendered by default in browsers.

output_questions.question:
What is the output? ```html

<root><child>X</child></root>

```
output_questions.explanation: Entities display the XML as text.

output_questions.question:
What is visible? ```html

HTML is not case sensitive. XML is case sensitive.

```
output_questions.output: HTML is not case sensitive. XML is case sensitive.
output_questions.explanation: This is regular text and is displayed as written.

output_questions.question:
What will the browser show? ```html

XML allows custom tags. HTML uses predefined tags.

```
output_questions.output: XML allows custom tags. HTML uses predefined tags.
output_questions.explanation: Plain text is rendered normally.

output_questions.question:
What does this code render? ```html

<html><body>HTML tags</body></html>

```
output_questions.explanation: Angle brackets are shown as text using entities.

output_questions.question:
What is rendered?

```html
<person><name>Jane</name></person>
```
output_questions.explanation: Custom tags are ignored by browsers unless styled or processed.

output_questions.question:
What is displayed? ```html

This is HTML, not XML.

```
